page.title: 16Ludlam Sysco.
page.content: The building now occupied by{Ludlam {Sysco}in Broadway, Market Lavington was originally part of a brickworks.They make special monitors for{Shell}and{Esso}which are used in {North Sea Oil}and for other oil producing countries.They now produce about twelve monitors a year.They employ sixty workers. They export goods to places like {Korea,Kuwait,South Africa, Abudabi, {Australia,Holland, Norway and Oman. {Sysco}was originally called Systems and Components but is now called Sysco for short.They have three computers one big and two small. The biggest one is used for communicating with Bath and the other two are used for accounts. They use stainless steel and manel.The workers work an eight hour day.
